paste.title: Base64 encoder/decoder written in python
paste.content:
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
#
# This base64 converter script is released to the public domain.
#
# USAGE: base64 [-d] FILE
# encodes FILE to FILE.txt as a base64 text file
# -d: decodes FILE.txt to FILE
#

import sys
import base64

def encode(token):
    with file(token, 'rb') as infile:
        with file("%s.txt" % token, 'w') as outfile:
            base64.encode(infile, outfile)

def decode(token):
    with file(token, 'rb') as infile:
        with file("%s.new" % token, 'w') as outfile:
            base64.decode(infile, outfile)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    encoding = True
    if len(sys.argv) == 1:
        print "USAGE: b64encoder [-d] FILE"
        print "where '-d' decodes instead of encoding"
        sys.exit(1)

    if "-d" in sys.argv:
        encoding = False

    if encoding:
        if len(sys.argv) != 2:
            print "USAGE: b64encoder [-d] FILE"
            print "where '-d' decodes instead of encoding"
            sys.exit(1)
        else:
            encode(sys.argv[1])
    else:
        if len(sys.argv) != 3:
            print "USAGE: b64encoder [-d] FILE"
            print "where '-d' decodes instead of encoding"
            sys.exit(1)
        else:
            decode(sys.argv[2])
